etymologies: mid 16th century (in the sense ‘to spill, splash’): probably related to slip. Early use of the noun denoted ‘slushy mud’, the first of the current senses (‘unappetizing food’) dating from the mid 17th century

definitions: (of a liquid) spill or flow over the edge of a container, typically as a result of careless handling

examples.text: water slopped over the edge of the sink

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of direction

shortDefinitions: spill or flow over edge of container

definitions: cause (a liquid) to spill over the edge of a container

examples.text: in spite of his care he slopped some water

shortDefinitions: cause liquid to spill or overflow in such way

definitions: apply or put (something) somewhere in a casual or careless manner

examples.text: they spent their weekend slopping on paint

shortDefinitions: apply or pour liquid substance in casual or careless manner

definitions: wade through (a wet or muddy area)

examples.text: they were slopping through paddy fields

definitions: feed slops to (an animal, especially a pig)

examples.text: they think a farmer's wife spends all her time slopping hogs

definitions: speak or write in a sentimentally effusive manner; gush
shortDefinitions: speak or write in sentimentally effusive manner

definitions: waste water from a kitchen, bathroom, or chamber pot that has to be emptied by hand
shortDefinitions: waste water from kitchen, bathroom, or chamber pot

definitions: semiliquid kitchen refuse, often used as animal food

examples.text: she emptied some slops for the chickens

shortDefinitions: semi-liquid kitchen refuse, often used as animal food

examples.text: they fed us some slop in a bowl
country music is not all commercial slop

etymologies: late Middle English (in slop (sense 1)): from the second element of Old English oferslop ‘surplice’, of Germanic origin

definitions: wide, baggy pants common in the 16th and early 17th centuries, especially as worn by sailors.
shortDefinitions: wide, baggy trousers common in 16th and early 17th centuries

definitions: clothes and bedding supplied to sailors by the navy.
shortDefinitions: clothes and bedding supplied to sailors by navy
